>>37811066

"I'll lead the way." Nel lights a fluorescent torch, a rod with a green light at one end, soft, though bright, and makes his way down the stairs to where he pulled the Pegasus from. "It's like a maze. I'm not sure if there's much of anything down here. Stay close, alright?"

"Alright..."

You can see drains and holes in the walls where water pours in from outside. Weapons ready, you wade into ankle deep water by torch-light. The underground area seems to lead you in circles, to small openings and tunnels underneath the atrium. You don't find much of anything, and usher Nel, out of curiosity, in the direction of the parted wall.

There's occasionally a vibration as you round a corner. It feels like the walls are staring at you.

> [[ Ancient Cathedral - Inner Sanctum // PVP Disabled ]]

Then, you pass under a thick glass ceiling, where you can see far up above. A spiral staircase leads up through a tower with many floors and many doors, gold trim and opulent chandeliers. When the party's footsteps fall silent, you hear a distant sound high above, high-pitched, grinding, whining, like the point of a sword being dragged across a glass table. It's rhythmic, like a machine, like breathing, footsteps or heartbeats.

You don't find much of anything down here.
> Leave.
